Event.name: Making_faces
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> makes a particular facial expression, generally in response to some <fen>Internal_cause</fen> (generally an emotional state). Sometimes the <fen>Body_part</fen> involved in the expression is mentioned in lieu of the <fen>Agent</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Agent">His</fex> <fex name="Body_part">eyes</fex> <t>smile</t>, but his lips do not.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition: <def-root>The individual that assumes a particular facial expression.</def-root>

Arg.name: Internal_cause
Arg.definition: <def-root>The emotion or other mental state that leads the <fen>Agent</fen> to assume a facial expression.</def-root>

Arg.name: Body_part
Arg.definition: <def-root>The particular part of the face that the <fen>Agent</fen> moves into a facial expression.</def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition: <def-root>The amount to which the expression on the face of the <fen>Agent</fen> matches the prototypical image for the indicated facial expression.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the <fen>Agent</fen> that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). </def-root>

Arg.name: Intended_perceiver
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The individual that the <fen>Agent</fen> intends to see the facial expression; often the <fen>Intended_perceiver</fen> is also the focus of the emotional <fen>Internal_cause</fen> of the <fen>Agent</fen>.
<ex>Why don't you <t>smile</t> <fex name="Intended_perceiver">at me</fex> more often?</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>The point in time at which the change in facial_expression takes place.</def-root>

Arg.name: Location_of_protagonist
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The location relative to some viewer (often the <fen>Intended_perceiver</fen>) at which the <fen>Agent</fen> makes an expression.
<ex>He <t>smiled</t> up at me <fex name="Location_of_protagonist">from the bottom of the well</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Path_of_gaze
Arg.definition: <def-root>A path expression that describes a line from the <fen>Agent</fen> to the <fen>Intended_perceiver</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>The state of the <fen>Agent</fen> during the event.</def-root>

Arg.name: External_cause
Arg.definition: <def-root>An event experienced by the <fen>Agent</fen> that leads them to make an expression.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: frown.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: furrow one's brows in an expression indicating disapproval, displeasure, or concentration.

lexUnit.name: grimace.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: contort one's face in an expressive way

lexUnit.name: pout.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: push one's lips or bottom lip forward as an expression of petulant annoyance or in order to make oneself look sexually attractive.

lexUnit.name: scowl.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: frown in an angry or bad-tempered way.

lexUnit.name: smile.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: form one's features into a pleased, friendly, or amused expression, with the corners of the mouth turned up.

lexUnit.name: smirk.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: smile in an irritatingly smug or silly way.
